Class UIFactory

java.lang.Object
application.framework.UIFactory
public final class UIFactory extends Object
Utility class to reduce JavaFX boilerplate code.

This class provides various methods for creating commonly used JavaFX components (such as buttons, text fields, and labels) using builder pattern techniques. The goal is to reduce the repetitive code for UI component creation and allow for cleaner, more customizable UI element setups.

Author:
Dhruv

  • Constructor Details

    • UIFactory

  • Method Details

    • getPageForRole

      public static MyPages getPageForRole(Roles role)
      Returns the page associated with a specific role.

      This method maps user roles to pages. If a role is not found in the map, the default page is returned.

      Parameters:
      role - The Roles of the user.
      Returns:
      The MyPages associated with the given role.

    • createTextField

      @SafeVarargs public static javafx.scene.control.TextField createTextField(String prompt, Consumer<TextFieldBuilder>... configs)
      Creates a TextField with customized properties.

      This method uses the builder pattern to set up the text field with the provided configuration options.

      Parameters:
      prompt - The placeholder text for the text field.
      configs - Customizations for the TextFieldBuilder.
      Returns:
      A TextField with the specified properties.

    • createButton

      @SafeVarargs public static javafx.scene.control.Button createButton(String text, Consumer<ButtonBuilder>... configs)

      This method uses the builder pattern to set up the button with the provided configuration options.

      Parameters:
      text - The text to display on the button.
      configs - Customizations for the ButtonBuilder.
      Returns:
      A Button with the specified properties.

    • createCopyButton

      @SafeVarargs public static javafx.scene.control.Button createCopyButton(String initialText, Supplier<String> textSupplier, Consumer<CopyButtonBuilder>... configs)
      Creates a Button that copies text to the clipboard.

      This method uses the builder pattern to create a button that copies text to the clipboard when clicked.

      Parameters:
      initialText - The text displayed on the button initially.
      textSupplier - The supplier for the text to be copied to the clipboard.
      configs - Customizations for the CopyButtonBuilder.
      Returns:
      A Button with the specified properties.

    • showAlert

      public static Optional<javafx.scene.control.ButtonType> showAlert(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType alertType, String title, String content)
      Shows an alert dialog with the specified type, title, and content.
      Parameters:
      alertType - The type of the alert.
      title - The title of the alert.
      content - The content text of the alert.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the ButtonType that was clicked, or empty if closed without selection.

    • showConfirmation

      public static boolean showConfirmation(String title, String content)
      Shows a confirmation dialog with the specified title and content.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the confirmation dialog.
      content - The content text of the confirmation dialog.
      Returns:
      true if the user confirms, false if the user cancels.

    • createNavMenu

      @SafeVarargs public static javafx.scene.control.MenuButton createNavMenu(AppContext context, String menuText, Consumer<NavMenuBuilder>... configs)
      Creates a navigation menu for the user interface.

      This method generates a menu button that contains navigation options for the app, based on user roles, excluding their current role.

      Parameters:
      context - The application context.
      menuText - The text to display on the menu button.
      configs - Customizations for the NavMenuBuilder.
      Returns:
      A MenuButton with the specified properties.

    • createHomepageButton

      @SafeVarargs public static javafx.scene.control.Button createHomepageButton(String text, AppContext context, Consumer<HomepageButtonBuilder>... configs)
      Creates a homepage button for navigating to the user's homepage.

      If the current page is already the homepage, it will navigate to the user's specific homepage based on their currently selected role. If not, it will navigate to the default homepage.

      Parameters:
      text - The text to display on the homepage button.
      context - The application context.
      configs - Customizations for the HomepageButtonBuilder.
      Returns:
      A Button for navigating to the homepage.

    • createLogoutButton

      public static javafx.scene.control.Button createLogoutButton(AppContext context)
      Creates a logout button that clears the current role and navigates to the login page.
      Parameters:
      context - The application context.
      Returns:
      A Button for logging out.

    • createBackButton

      public static javafx.scene.control.Button createBackButton(AppContext context)
      Creates a back button that navigates to the previous page.
      Parameters:
      context - The application context.
      Returns:
      A Button for navigating back.
